title: The Adventures of Frank Clark: The Consulting Hero

story.text: In Grover's Mill, Frank Clark, known for his impeccable organizing skills and keen strategic advice as a consultant, discovers a strange glowing artifact buried in his backyard while planting a tree. This artifact gives him the power to see the immediate consequences of any action taken by people around him.

Frank decides to test his new powers at work. As a consultant, he prevents a major data breach by advising the IT team on a crucial oversight. His reputation skyrockets as he begins to use his special ability to foresee outcomes, making him an invaluable asset to his clients.

After work, he stumbles upon a robbery in progress. Using his power, Frank advises the store manager to secretly alert the police while directing customers to safety through an optimal escape route, leading to the robbers' arrest without any casualties.

Artificial news about Frank’s powers starts circulating, making him a target. He navigates through complex social situations, only using his powers to subtly guide people away from making decisions that would endanger him or others.

Frank uses his consulting skills combined with his power to help local government officials make better community planning decisions, significantly improving traffic flow and public safety measures in his town.

Recognizing the strain his powers put on his personal life, Frank takes a well-deserved break. He spends the day organizing a local charity event, quietly ensuring its success and the safety of all attendees without overtly using his powers.

Frank retraces the origin of the artifact and finds out it’s part of an ancient set meant to bestow wisdom upon its wielder. Respectful of its power, he decides to consult a historian and a scientist to safeguard the artifact and study its potentials responsibly.

ending: Thus, Frank Clark continued leveraging his unique blend of powers and expertise to aid and protect his community, one calculated step at a time.
moral: With great power comes great responsibility, and often, the best way to use such power is with caution and altruism.
